message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with natural language processing tasks and specifically focuses on the issue of language evolution causing data drift between time-steps in sequential decision-making tasks. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper proposes a method for sequentially aligning learned representations, which is a machine learning technique, indicating that it could also belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also mentions neural network architectures, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Furthermore, the paper evaluates its method on three challenging tasks, including prediction of paper acceptance and author stance prediction, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV), respectively.
